title: Historic Cabinet Turnover & Chaos
summary: Trump had more turnover than any president since 1980. 91% turnover among senior staff. 4 Chiefs of Staff, 4 National Security Advisers, 14 cabinet secretaries resigned. NPR: highest Cabinet turnover 'going back 100 years.'
keyFacts: 91% turnover among senior executive staff by end of term (vs. 78% Reagan, 74% Clinton, 71% Obama)
14 Senate-confirmed cabinet secretaries resigned (more than 5 predecessors combined)
4 Chiefs of Staff: Reince Priebus, John Kelly, Mick Mulvaney, Mark Meadows
4 National Security Advisers: Michael Flynn, H.R. McMaster, John Bolton, Robert O'Brien
NPR: Cabinet turnover was highest 'going back 100 years'
Turnover rate exceeded five predecessors' full first terms in just 32 months
Michael Flynn lasted only 24 days - shortest ever National Security Adviser
Often announced firings via Twitter, adding 'dimension of public humiliation'
